content.data: The CxConstruction.mdf file stores the Cabinet, Closet, and Drawer & Roll Out Construction data, as well as User Created Standards and Intelli-Joints.
The following is the breakdown of the tables and their fields:

rows: A unique number to reference the connection.
A global unique identification for the connection
A boolean value set true if this is a read-only system connection

content.data: A unique number to reference the connection.
A global unique identification for the connection
A boolean value set true if this is a read-only system connection
This table stores the Connection Set Map.

rows: A unique number to reference the connection set map.
A cross reference to [Connection].[ID] for the master connection ID.
A cross reference to [Connection].[ID] for the slave connection ID.

content.data: A unique number to reference the connection set map.
A cross reference to [Connection].[ID] for the master connection ID.
A cross reference to [Connection].[ID] for the slave connection ID.
This table stores the Connection Standard Map.

rows: A unique number to identify this record
A cross reference to the [Connection].[ID] field linking this record to a Connection
A cross reference to [refConnectionStandard].[ID] field linking this record to a ConnectionStandard
A boolean value set true if this question has been asked.
The option button selected for this standard.
Any value entered for this standard.
A cross reference to the [refParameterType].[ID] field indicating the type of data stored in the value field
If non-zero, a cross reference to the [refUnitOfMeasure].[ID] field defining what unit of measure to display the value

content.data: A unique number to identify this record
A cross reference to the [Connection].[ID] field linking this record to a Connection
A cross reference to [refConnectionStandard].[ID] field linking this record to a ConnectionStandard
A boolean value set true if this question has been asked.
The option button selected for this standard.
Any value entered for this standard.
A cross reference to the [refParameterType].[ID] field indicating the type of data stored in the value field
If non-zero, a cross reference to the [refUnitOfMeasure].[ID] field defining what unit of measure to display the value

rows: A unique number to reference the construction method.
A global unique identification for the construction.
A boolean value set true if this is a read-only system construction method.

content.data: A unique number to reference the construction method.
A global unique identification for the construction.
A boolean value set true if this is a read-only system construction method.
This table stores the Construction Menu Tree.

rows: A unique identification for each ConstructionMenuTree item
A cross reference to [ConstructionMenuTree].[ID] indicating the parent of this menu item
The name of the construction menu tree item
A boolean value set true to use the actual part name for this item as the display text
The default display text the can be overwritten by the localized string
A reference to the localized string ID

content.data: A unique identification for each ConstructionMenuTree item
A cross reference to [ConstructionMenuTree].[ID] indicating the parent of this menu item
The name of the construction menu tree item
A boolean value set true to use the actual part name for this item as the display text
The default display text the can be overwritten by the localized string
A reference to the localized string ID
This table stores the Construction Parameters.

rows: A unique number to reference the construction parameter

content.data: A unique number to reference the construction parameter
This table stores the Construction Shape data.

rows: A unique identification for each shape.
A cross-reference to [refShapeType].[ID] indicating the shape type.
A global unique identification for the shape

content.data: A unique identification for each shape.
A cross-reference to [refShapeType].[ID] indicating the shape type.
A global unique identification for the shape
This table stores the Connection Standard Map.

rows: A unique number to identify this record
A cross reference to the [Construction].[ID] field linking this record to a construction
A cross reference to either [refCaseStandard].[ID], [refDrawerStandard].[ID] or [refTopStandard].[ID] field linking this record to a Standard based on ConstructionType
A boolean value set true if this question has been asked.
The option button selected for this standard.
Any value entered for this standard.
A cross reference to the [refParameterType].[ID] field indicating the type of data stored in the value field
If non-zero, a cross reference to the [refUnitOfMeasure].[ID] field defining what unit of measure to display the value
A cross reference to the [refCaseType].[ID] field indicating the case type for this record based on ConstructionType

content.data: A unique number to identify this record
A cross reference to the [Construction].[ID] field linking this record to a construction
A cross reference to either [refCaseStandard].[ID], [refDrawerStandard].[ID] or [refTopStandard].[ID] field linking this record to a Standard based on ConstructionType
A boolean value set true if this question has been asked.
The option button selected for this standard.
Any value entered for this standard.
A cross reference to the [refParameterType].[ID] field indicating the type of data stored in the value field
If non-zero, a cross reference to the [refUnitOfMeasure].[ID] field defining what unit of measure to display the value
A cross reference to the [refCaseType].[ID] field indicating the case type for this record based on ConstructionType
This table stores Construction Info data.

rows: A unique ID for this record.
The current schema of the database
The date this was last syncronized with offline data
A boolean flag set true if this database is currently offline

content.data: A unique ID for this record.
The current schema of the database
The date this was last syncronized with offline data
A boolean flag set true if this database is currently offline

rows: A unique number to reference the construction migration data

content.data: A unique number to reference the construction migration data
This table stores extra case information.

rows: A unique number to reference the extra information.
A cross reference to [Construction].[ID] linking this record to the Construction table.

content.data: A unique number to reference the extra information.
A cross reference to [Construction].[ID] linking this record to the Construction table.
This table stores extra drawer information.

A cross reference to [Construction].[ID] linking this record to the Construction table.

rows: A unique number to reference the Intelli-Joint.
A global unique identification for the Intelli-Joint.

content.data: A unique number to reference the Intelli-Joint.
A global unique identification for the Intelli-Joint.
This table stores the Intelli-Joint operations.

rows: A unique number to reference the Intelli-Joint operation
A boolean flag set true if the Operation is to be a Master Operation.
Specifies the Tool selected for the Operation. A Cross reference to [Tools].[rGUID] in the Psnc.mdb database.
The value for the Operations X Location.
The value for the Operations Y Location.
The value for the Operations Width/Diameter.
The value for the Operations Spacing/Length.
The value for the Operations Depth.
The value for the Operations Quantity.

content.data: A unique number to reference the Intelli-Joint operation
A boolean flag set true if the Operation is to be a Master Operation.
Specifies the Tool selected for the Operation. A Cross reference to [Tools].[rGUID] in the Psnc.mdb database.
The value for the Operations X Location.
The value for the Operations Y Location.
The value for the Operations Width/Diameter.
The value for the Operations Spacing/Length.
The value for the Operations Depth.
The value for the Operations Quantity.
This table stores the Intelli-Joint Operation Parameters.

rows: A unique number to reference the Intelli-Joint operation parameter

content.data: A unique number to reference the Intelli-Joint operation parameter
A lookup table for Case question lines.

rows: A unique identifier for this record

content.data: A unique identifier for this record
A lookup table for Case Standards.

rows: A unique identification for each case standard
The name of the case standard
A brief description of case standard
A cross reference to [refCaseQLine].[ID] indicating what branch this standard applies to
A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a base case
A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a base 45 case
A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a base 90 case
A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a Upper case
A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a Upper 45 case
A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a Upper 90 case
A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a tall case
A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a tall 45 case
A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a tall 90 case
A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a vanity case
A boolean value set true if this standard should only be shown for a frame construction type
A boolean value set true if this standard should only be shown for a frameless construction type
A cross reference to the [refParameterType].[ID] field indicating the type of data stored in the value field for the default parameter type for this standard

content.data: A unique identification for each case standard
The name of the case standard
A brief description of case standard
A cross reference to [refCaseQLine].[ID] indicating what branch this standard applies to

A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a tall case
A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a tall 45 case
A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a tall 90 case
A boolean value set true if this standard should be shown for a vanity case
A boolean value set true if this standard should only be shown for a frame construction type
A boolean value set true if this standard should only be shown for a frameless construction type
A cross reference to the [refParameterType].[ID] field indicating the type of data stored in the value field for the default parameter type for this standard

This table stores the User Created Standards.

rows: A unique number used to reference the UCS.
Represents the order that the UCS runs in. This is also the order that the UCS's are displayed in the UCS Editor.
A cross reference to [refUCSType].[ID] indicating the type of UCS: 1 = An Add Part UCS, 2 = A Modify Part UCS, 3 = A Delete Part UCS
A cross reference to [refUCSObjectType].[ID] indicating a PartID=1, IJointID=2, Dovetail ToolID=3, Door=4, DrwFrnt=5, Dado=6, HBore=7, VBore=8
A Part, Tool or IJoint GUID based on the UCSObjectTypeID
A cross reference to [refUCSLinkToType].[ID] indicating object type the Added Part (UcsTypeID=1) is linked to
A cross reference to the [CxMaterials].[Part].[rGUID] of the part this object is linked to
Represents the assembly Name chosen for the UCS. Wildcards * and ? are allowed.
Represents the Material selected for the Part in the UCS. Cross referenced to [CxMaterials].[Material].[rGUID]
A boolean flag set true if the Part is to be displayed graphically.
The location of the Library Part called in the UCS.
The actual coding that makes up the UCS.
A boolean flag set true if the UCS has been manually modified.
A boolean flag set true if the UCS has been disabled.
A boolean flag set true if the UCS should be applied prior to build.
Licensing data to required to unlock standard.
A global unique identification for the user created standard

content.data: A unique number used to reference the UCS.
Represents the order that the UCS runs in. This is also the order that the UCS's are displayed in the UCS Editor.
A cross reference to [refUCSType].[ID] indicating the type of UCS: 1 = An Add Part UCS, 2 = A Modify Part UCS, 3 = A Delete Part UCS
A cross reference to [refUCSObjectType].[ID] indicating a PartID=1, IJointID=2, Dovetail ToolID=3, Door=4, DrwFrnt=5, Dado=6, HBore=7, VBore=8
A Part, Tool or IJoint GUID based on the UCSObjectTypeID
A cross reference to [refUCSLinkToType].[ID] indicating object type the Added Part (UcsTypeID=1) is linked to
A cross reference to the [CxMaterials].[Part].[rGUID] of the part this object is linked to
Represents the assembly Name chosen for the UCS. Wildcards * and ? are allowed.
Represents the Material selected for the Part in the UCS. Cross referenced to [CxMaterials].[Material].[rGUID]
A boolean flag set true if the Part is to be displayed graphically.
The location of the Library Part called in the UCS.
The actual coding that makes up the UCS.
A boolean flag set true if the UCS has been manually modified.
A boolean flag set true if the UCS has been disabled.
A boolean flag set true if the UCS should be applied prior to build.
Licensing data to required to unlock standard.
A global unique identification for the user created standard
This table stores the UCS Assembly Class Map.

rows: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly class to a UCS.
A cross-reference to [refUCSAssemblyClass].[ID] indicating the case class selected.

content.data: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly class to a UCS.
A cross-reference to [refUCSAssemblyClass].[ID] indicating the case class selected.

rows: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly Type to a UCS.
A cross-reference to [refUCSAssemblyType].[ID] indicating the case type selected.

content.data: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly Type to a UCS.
A cross-reference to [refUCSAssemblyType].[ID] indicating the case type selected.
This table stores the UCS Construction Map.

rows: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly Type to a UCS.
A reference to the ID field in either the Case, Drawer or Top table indicating a filter on which construction methods this standard applies to
A cross-reference to [refUCSConstructionType].[ID] linking this record to a construction type

content.data: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly Type to a UCS.
A reference to the ID field in either the Case, Drawer or Top table indicating a filter on which construction methods this standard applies to
A cross-reference to [refUCSConstructionType].[ID] linking this record to a construction type
This table stores the UCS Door Map.

rows: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly Type to a UCS.
A reference to the [Doors].[rGUID] field in the door database indicating a filter on which Doors this standard applies to

content.data: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly Type to a UCS.
A reference to the [Doors].[rGUID] field in the door database indicating a filter on which Doors this standard applies to
This table stores the UCS Ends.

rows: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly Type to a UCS.
A cross-reference to [refUCSEndType].[ID] indicating the end type for the left end
The value of the radius, angle or clip for the left end
A cross-reference to [refUCSEndType].[ID] indicating the end type for the right end
The value of the radius, angle or clip for the right end

content.data: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly Type to a UCS.
A cross-reference to [refUCSEndType].[ID] indicating the end type for the left end
The value of the radius, angle or clip for the left end
A cross-reference to [refUCSEndType].[ID] indicating the end type for the right end
The value of the radius, angle or clip for the right end
This table stores the UCS Intelli-Joint Location.

rows: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly Type to a UCS.
Place Intelli-Joint on the near width edge
Place Intelli-Joint on the far width edge
Place Intelli-Joint on the near length edge
Place Intelli-Joint on the far length edge
If true Intelli-Joint scope is limited to the case it lives in.  If false it can create operation on adjacent assemblies.

content.data: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly Type to a UCS.
Place Intelli-Joint on the near width edge
Place Intelli-Joint on the far width edge
Place Intelli-Joint on the near length edge
Place Intelli-Joint on the far length edge
If true Intelli-Joint scope is limited to the case it lives in.  If false it can create operation on adjacent assemblies.
This table stores the UCS Parameters.

rows: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly Type to a UCS.
A cross reference to [refUCSParameterType].[ID] indicating what feature in the UI this data is for
A cross reference to [refUCSOperatorType].[ID] indicating what operator to use in the UI for this data

content.data: A unique identification for each record.

This table stores the UCS Variables.

rows: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly Type to a UCS.
A cross reference to [refUCSVariableType].[ID] indicating the variable type
A boolean value set true if the variable has been assigned a value outside of the code editor
Stores the list of choices available for this variable

content.data: A unique identification for each record.
A cross-reference to [UCS].[ID] linking this assmbly Type to a UCS.
